document_data.name: Pesh
document_data.mainbody: '''Pesh''' was a [[Bedine]] nomad who traveled across the deserts of [[Anauroch]] during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Personality:
Pesh believed that the adventurous life was the best well-lived. He was eager to learn more about the greater world and was always welcoming to any adventurers he encountered.

He was a kind and trusting individual, if not a little naive and reckless. Despite his naivete, Pesh was quite knowledgeable about how to survive in the harsh desert climate.
document_data.Relationships: His best friend was his grandfather [[Shamir]], a more practical and discerning individual. Together they had a trusty [[camel]] named [[Old Stink]].
document_data.History: Some time during the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Pesh and Shamir found the inert [[Sapphire Sentinel]], an ancient [[stone golem]] half-buried in the sands of the desert. Shortly after its discovery, a group of wandering adventurers came across the boy and his grandfather. The Sapphire Sentinel "awoke" while in the group's presence, awing Pesh and sparking his yearn for adventure.
